definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding

the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature, namely: A Dream of Red Mansions 紅樓夢|红楼梦[Hong2 lou2 Meng4], Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]

sentences.english: Mansions" is one of China's four famous book !"
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道“红楼梦”是中国的四大名著之一。

sentences.english: I like most to read English classics translated by Mr.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢看朱生豪移译的英文名著。

sentences.english: The three kinds of the idea contradictions and their growing relationship with famous literary works.
sentences.chinese: 思想矛盾的三种类型及其与文学名著的伴生关系。

sentences.english: We ought to remain a little aloof and take pleasure in this aloofness, the interweave of a given masterpiece.
sentences.chinese: 并享受着这种冷漠，伴着颤抖来品味名著。

sentences.english: Classical is the leaven of spirit and the ladder to wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 名著是精神的酵母，智慧的天梯。

sentences.english: In the Peony Pavilion " is a legendary drama with feminist tendency."
sentences.chinese: 名著《牡丹亭》是一部有着女性主义倾向的传奇作品。

sentences.english: I also use it as literature.
"Sherlock Holmes" is the world's ever-popular classics.
sentences.chinese: 《福尔摩斯探案集》是全世界畅销不衰的经典名著。

sentences.english: As we all know, GuoYu is a masterpiece of biographically historic literature about Pre-Qin period.
sentences.chinese: 《国语》是先秦时期一部史传文学名著。

sentences.english: I heard there are four masterpieces of China.Have you read all of them?
sentences.chinese: 我听说中国有四大名著，你都读过吗？

sentences.english: Jet:The movie is loosely based on the classic Chinese novel Journey to the West.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影是根据中国古典名著《西游记》改编的。

sentences.english: I never tire of reading classics.
sentences.chinese: 这些古典名著我百读不厌。

sentences.english: I have many foreign language books, most of which are world famous works.
sentences.chinese: 我有许多外语书，其中很多是世界名著。

sentences.english: Now TV producers will re-shoot the plays.
sentences.chinese: 而目前，电视创造者又致力于对名著举行翻拍。

sentences.english: Dickens'; A Tale of Two Cities is a literary classic.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯的《双城记》是一部文学名著。

sentences.english: I heard there are four masterpieces of China.
sentences.chinese: 我听说中国有四大名著，你都读过吗？

definition: the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature, namely: A Dream of Red Mansions 紅樓夢|红楼梦[Hong2 lou2 Meng4], Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio, Qing dynasty book of tales by 蒲松齡|蒲松龄[Pu2 Song1 ling2]
name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
reference book consisting of material quoted from many sources, arranged by category (about 600 of which were compiled between the 3rd and 18th centuries in China)
